Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay if your business is on the NE side of town”
Reviews.Author: Kawhona
Reviews.Content: Pretty standard for the Hyatt Place Brand which in general I think represents a good value for a mid priced hotel. Like most it is modern in its layout and styling. Right now there is construction going on that makes it a little inconvenient but, for me this is a half step up from the mid priced competition of Hampton, Holiday Inn Select and Courtyard. Breakfasts are not the best and Hyatt must have a corporate deal with Pepsi but, you get a nice room , nice pillows and usually upgraded TVs and content.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madwolf
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business, and stayed at the Hyatt Place on the north side of Indianapolis. The hotel is clean and usually very busy during the week. 1st if you stay at this hotel avoid the north sided of the building as the traffic noise is horrific form I-465. Also avoid rooms adjoining the elevator, no so quiet. Lastly don't count on the internet in your room is spotty at best. I've stayed in this hotel 5 times in the past 4 years... plan on going to restaurant or Star buck to get access.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: Tschaller
Reviews.Content: Location is Northwest of downtown - customer service experience at check-in was excellent. Arrived on a rainy\slushy eve and the check-in was quick and the host pleasant and helpful. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for Black Friday Shopping”
Reviews.Author: Ustravelgirl13
Reviews.Content: We stay at this location every year on Thankgiving evening. It is a great location and close to all the great shopping. Rooms clean and staff was super friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: getagondola
Reviews.Content: A very spacious room with a seating area, large flat screen tv, mini fridge, and a nice bed. I really enjoyed the kitchenette area, and the room seemed more like a suite than a standard hotel room. Took advantage of the decent free breakfast off the lobby. Not much drawer space for clothes and it was extremely dry in the room were the only minor problems. Rooms facing the highway can be a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Indy”
Reviews.Author: BeachLover1501
Reviews.Content: My room was spacious, clean and quiet. Liked the sitting area with the large, flat-screen TV. Service was attentive and helpful. Would have liked a mini-bar in the room or possibly room service, but that's a small issue - there were a nice array of snacks, light meals and soft drinks available in the lobby. A good location at Keystone at the Crossing, with shopping, good restaurants and a movie theatre all within 5 minutes or less from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Place”
Reviews.Author: mlynn46953
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt Place for a girlfriends getaway a few months ago. It was very clean and the rooms are nice. I liked the feel of the room as there is two sections, one with a couch, sink, T.V. and desk and then the other with the bed. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bealll95
Reviews.Content: Our room was huge! Super nice! The staff was amazing! They saved us after the Sheraton lost our reservation AND now they were FULL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Take lie off about distance between hotel and verizon music center!!”
Reviews.Author: aldean1fan
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms here because of internet website saying it was .2 miles from the Verizon Music Center and we thought we could walk there and back. When we checked and I asked about location and the girl said "its about a 20 minute cab ride depending on the traffic" I asked about what was said on the internet so she comes back with "we get that all the time!" Well we went ahead and got ready and got a cab and it ended up being a 20-25 minute and $45.00 ride ONE WAY!!!!!!! Which meant another $45.00 for the way back! Yes we could have driven there but it was the whole reason of staying at this place. Please take that off the website! So if you are booking here thinking you will be able to walk to Verizon.....don't!!!!! Other than that the rooms were nice and the bed was comfy

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, depending on your purposes”
Reviews.Author: lmarcas
Reviews.Content: We dropped our daughter off at the grandparents' and enjoyed a nice quiet night of 10+ hours of sleep. For these purposes, the hotel was great -- a nice king bed in a quiet room -- we heard nothing on a rather sleepy Saturday night. The hotel is an older hotel that recently was renovated, so you get all the shiny finishes but can see the old bones at times. Continental breakfast was pretty good. My main quibble was that I tried to work on my laptop, and the Internet connection was horribly slow. Once I had my corporate VPN set up, I was getting only 10-20 KB/s, leaving Outlook basically inoperative.

Reviews.Title: “Nice oversized room!”
Reviews.Author: Missuso
Reviews.Content: Our room was great. Two full size beds, toilet and shower are separated from the mirror and sink which helps speed along getting ready with two teenage girls! Large flat screen t.v. that swivels so it can be seen easily from the beds and the couch. Couch pulls out to a sleeper and is in a sitting area as large as the area where the beds are. Includes coffee pot, coffee, kitchen sink, and mini-fridge. Staff was very courteous. Check-in was easy and quick. Breakfast left a bit to be desired. No hot food, just apples, oranges, yogurt, cold cereal, milk, oj, toast & bagels. Better than nothing I guess. We were there to shop. Spent some time at Keystone Mall and other stores in the area, then took the short drive into downtown to visit Circle Center Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but could use some updates”
Reviews.Author: sbsneetch28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stopped at the Hyatt Place in Indy overnight on our way home from a business trip. We got a great rate on it, and if we were sure we'd get that rate we'd stay here again. There were a couple of things I noticed about the rooms and hallways. The first was that the doors to the rooms looked scuffed and scratched. They probably just needed a fresh coat of paint. The second, the ceiling in the room had some places where it looked brown. Not quite sure why. Third, there was some rust on and around the fixtures in the bathtub. The next morning, I took the elevator down to the lobby and it looked like someone had spilled food all over the floor. Breakfast was good, however. Staff was excellent. Everyone greeted us and made us feel at home. The overall cleanliness of the room was great. Room size was nice, and we really enjoyed the large TV. As I said before, I'm not sure if I would want to pay full price for this hotel, but for the rate we got it was a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is terrible and they do not fulfill their promises.”
Reviews.Author: hjhurt
Reviews.Content: This hotel overcharged my credit card not only once, but twice (for over $100 on both charges). When contacted, they promised to alleviate the situation by removing the charges. It took 4 phone calls over a four week period to fix the first mistake. It has been two months now, and they still haven't fixed the second mistake. At this point, I've paid almost $400 for a $180 room. I've had to talk to a different manager every time I've called. Beware, these people obviously don't know how to run a credit card machine. Only go here if you can afford to pay double for your room.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but there are definitely problems”
Reviews.Author: cstone79
Reviews.Content: Pros: The layout of the Hyatt place room is excellent. The new self check-in service worked well. The exercise room/equipment is small but in great shape (personal headphones and TVs on each piece of equipment was a nice touch). Excellent big screen flat panel TVs are very nice in the room. Cons: If you have a room on the highway side of the hotel, it will be very, very loud. Ask for a room on the other side of the hotel. The air/heat system is loud and does not seem to actually respond based on the temperature entered. It's very difficult to regulate the temperature in the room. I'd recommend this room with some reservations.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean and low cost”
Reviews.Author: JanieC51
Reviews.Content: The price was so good that I wondered what the hotel would be like. It had EVERYTHING that I need. Great TV, clean and well-laid out room, fast room service (I didn't mind going down to the lobby to get it because the price was very reasonable), great breakfast, happy faces at the check-in and check-out. Very nice, cheerful people. I look forward to trying another Hyatt Place. Have already told friends about my VERY POSITIVE experience,

Reviews.Title: “Like some Hyatt Places - this one's a dump”
Reviews.Author: megustamex
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at 3 Hyatt Places now with my husband and 2 children. We loved the first one we stayed at in Lexington, KY; it was newly built, and we fell in love with the modern decor and big lounge area in the room. The last 2 in Louisville and this one in Indy were former Amerisuites, according to the front desk, and were rehabbed to fit the Hyatt Place decor. The one in Louisville was at least clean; this one was really bad. The ceiling looked like it had leaked several times in long seams and seemed like it might fall in places at any minute. The smell of the room was horrible, like an old moldy hotel room, and it was humid the whole night despite the A/C constantly running. The bathroom tiles were cracked in half and the caulk against the tub had pulled away and was filthy. The tub itself had non-skid stickers on it and were dirty gray. The doors looked like they had been patched with a bad coat of paint over and over, poorly. Dirty bedside tables with sticky goo on them. The whole place screamed "re-purposed Amerisuites", as if they simply threw on a coat of paint and added some new furniture. The breakfast, which I've enjoyed in the other Hyatt Places, was atrocious. I don't know if they just couldn't handle the Sunday crowd, but I had to go through 5 plates before I found a clean one and the glasses were all dirty as well. They didn't have any silverware except spoons and kept running out of food. The decaf was weakly brewed to the color of light tea. I sat down to eat and it seemed that the chair arms had never been washed; I stuck to them. It was just completely disappointing. My husband and I agreed that we would never stay in a Hyatt Place again unless it has been built from the ground up.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good stay”
Reviews.Author: 10withamop
Reviews.Content: I often have to travel to Indy for work and always try to stay at the Keystone Hyatt. Very good location near many shops and restaurants. Staff is always helpful and rooms are very nice and clean. Fridge and microwave in the room as well. Been there 4-5 times now and never had a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jdevries
Reviews.Content: This is my first experience with a Hyatt Place hotel. While they have a unique and inviting theme with these hotels, we were disappointed with this property. The hotel is literally 10 feet from I-465, be sure to request a room on the south side to avoid all the traffic noise. It is also very difficult to find. Being so close to I-465, you would think it very easy, but you have to exit off I-465, then take another exit off Keystone avenue, and then turn into a business park. The hotel sits at the very back of the park behind an office building and is not visible from the intersection nor are there any signs to point the way. The hotel also has horrible front desk service. The guests in front of us at check in requested to pay one night in cash, another on a credit card. This took the attention of both front desk employees and a couple of phone calls before they could figure it out. c Check in time -10 minutes. There was absolutely nobody around the next morning during checkout and it wasn't like it was an unpopular time to check out, it was 7:45am. After waiting forever and multiple unsuccessful attempts at using the express check out kiosks, I finally grabbed some poor guy pushing a mop and asked that he go find someone that could check us out. Asking for a copy of my receipt caused more problems, the clerk had to run to some back office to print a copy. Check out time - 20 minutes. The "High Energy" breakfast was also pretty disappointing. It consisted of toast or bagels, yogurt, and a fruit salad. The room itself was very nice, minus a few issues with the shower. As I mentioned above, this is a unique concept. They have moved the bathroom from the traditional front corner of the room over to the back wall, creating a large living space with a sectional couch, ottoman, sink, mini fridge, and work desk. This area is separated from the sleeping area by a short partition, giving the appearance of a two room suite. The 42 inch flat screen TV is mounted on the wall in the center of the room, allowing you to watch from either side. It also had a panel that allowed you to hook up any number of different devices, dvd player, etc.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay -What more could i ask for-”
Reviews.Author: Laura1726
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, beautifly decorated and smart from the lobby areas to the rooms. I loved the 42 plasma in the room and it has all the connetions on the side wall for hookup of any game system, dvd, computer ect. this was great for the kids wii. The staff were great and I would stay at this and any other hyatt any time!

Reviews.Title: “i liked it”
Reviews.Author: tjdollar
Reviews.Content: the beds a great the tv was great i love the atmosphere. homey.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Noisy location!”
Reviews.Author: Madwolf
Reviews.Content: Was in Indy for business trip and wanted hotel away from airport. Room and desk service were great. But don't get a room on the north side of the hotel... its up against Hwy I-465... noise all night! If they put you in a room on the north side... change rooms or find another hotel! - R

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: judang
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a red eye flight to Indianapolis at 8:30am. Airport pick-up. Called the hotel to let them know we had arrived at the airport - they sent the driver back around to get us. As we entered the hotel the driver went behind the desk (everyone on the staff muli - tasks) to check on an early check in for us. He let us know that breakfast was being served (danish, cereal, oatmeal, fruit) and to please help ourselves while he was completing a task for another customer and would check on our room. He let us know that the room was ready. The room (nice dcor) is divided into two sections living and sleeping. The living side had a nice pull out couch including a nice blanket and pillows, desk and sink and refrig. with coffee maker. The bedroom side had two beds very nice linens, blankets, pillows and the bathroom. The closet was small but deep to one side. A flat screen Tv is centered between the 2 areas. They have a small cooked to order menu (great hamburger) wine and beer.I would not call it a restaurant. Bar seating and tables. There are two computers for your use. They have transportion to a local mall that you need to sign up for. We were running late with dinner and they came a little later to pick us up. Everyone on staff was there to help. Not once did we ever hear that's not my job or department. Awesome customer service.

Reviews.Title: “I am now a Hyatt Place Fan, see you later Marriott Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: solohobo
Reviews.Content: As a regional manager, i am many times in a location with few better quality lodging choices, and over the years prefer the Marriott Courtyards, but these new Hyatt places are great, the rooms are better, nice lounge/couch, great TV, free Internet and Breakfast, and they have free computers/printers too. I have been staying 3 times year at the Marriott next door, but for almost $80 less, the Hyatt is fine, I have stayed there 4 times in 4 months, with 2 more in end of Feb. Though my company will pay whichever I choose, why? The Marriott nice, no gripes, just the Hyatt a better value, especially the Breakfast and Internet and huge plasma.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: JamesR12
Reviews.Content: A little bit pricy, enjoyed the amenities. As for value for your dollar...just a bit over-priced. I would however stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Place is my choice for business travel.”
Reviews.Author: rahdmh
Reviews.Content: The convenient location makes this a perfect hotel for business travel. The rooms are large and have a desk and wi-fi. There is a wonderful free breakfast that is more than just donuts and coffee. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Checkin and check out is super easy at their self serve kiosk.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite as Nice”
Reviews.Author: MalibuStacy1982
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt Place/Keystone while honeymooning in Indy. We looked and looked for a great place to stay that was affordable. We decided Hyatt Keystone looked beautiful and had nice amenities. Unfortunately the hotel did not deliver in such nice accommodations. I'll admit, the staff was wonderful but our room (both of them) were less then wonderful. When we checked in we asked to be on the 6th floor, we thought the higher the better. We went to the room and it was just ok. Nothing special really except for the TV. We didnt really have set plans aside from a dinner reservation so we intended to plan our honeymoon as we went, with our laptop. The wi-fi signal was horrible. We asked for an Ethernet cable but were given a cable to plug into the wi-fi, which didnt work. My husband took the laptop down a few floors and discovered we needed to move rooms. As i said the staff was great and had no issues giving us a different room on a lower level. When we got to the second room the smell was horrible. There is a lot of mold somewhere in that room. I started getting itchy almost immediately. Its probably our fault for not asking for yet another room, but we decided to stay in that one. We actually went out and bought a bottle of Febreeze which only helped momentarily. There were also spider webs in just about every corner. I'm positive the air conditioning unit had black mold growing in it. The room obviously wasnt cleaned thoroughly, in quite a while. I also discovered the shower curtain had probably never been changed. It was slimy and you could see the yellowish color of tons of built up soap scum. I requested a new one, which we were given. The glasses given with our ice bucket were dirty, both times we were given a set. Our room was never serviced one of the days there. They dont even offer room service nor do they have vending machines. If you want a drink or a snack you have to go to the front desk and pay $9 for a deli sandwich, chips (only 2 flavors to choose from) and drink. There were salads and candy bars, and thats it. You're better off going to Wal-Mart and getting your own snacks. Which is what we did. Dont be fooled by the beautiful pictures shown. It is nothing like that in person.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ncypeacock
Reviews.Content: I am at a DFAS class and the class is being held at the Shearton. Read the reviews of the Shearton and everyone that is staying there is complaning loudly. The Hyatt is great and not a far walk from the Shearton. The free breakfast does not inlcude hot items but fresh fruit, oatmeal,cereal, bagles and muffins are all that is needed. The fitness center is small but the one elliptical machine does have TV and I was able to go for an hour since I was watching TV. I went at 4 am so I would not hold anyone up using the machine for an hour. The pool was cleaned. It went from 3 -5 foot. Quite a few TV stations. Glad I stayed here. Enjoyed walking around the mall at night.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: gest25
Reviews.Content: I stayed a night with my wife at this hotel and was very impressed. The room was newly renovated with a very comfortable bed, a great pivot flat-screen TV and a small, but clean and comfortable bathroom. The staff was incredibly helpful and recommended local fare including looking up movie times for us and telling us about places to eat. The hotel is located in an office park, but close to a nice mall and great little indie movie theater. The breakfast was only decent and seating was all taken up, but complimentary so I can't really complain. Great stay, I definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: blc1975
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt Place Keystone on a Friday and Saturday night. Located just off Interstate 465, it is a great location. It is in the same complex as several shopping locations such as Saks, Coldwater Creek, Nordstorms, etc. The room was very clean and spacious. There was no microwave in room although you do get the mini-fridge. You have access to a microwave in the lobby. The 42inch HD tv was excellent. For breakfast they serve cereals, fruit, and a few other amenities. I did notice they were checking the temps to make sure that the milk was at proper temperature, etc. You also can purchase food items in the lobby 24 hours per day albeit a little costly. A 20oz Diet Pepsi was 2.45, The pool looked very clean and adequte although I did not swim. The front staff were extremely courteous. Other hotel employees should take lessons from how they treat guests. Overall, I was VERY impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to Stay.”
Reviews.Author: joey207
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the night of 12/05/08 and could not have been happier with the hotel. The staff was friendly, my room and the public areas were very clean, the beds were comfortable, and the large flat screen television was very nice. If you are in this area, you would do yourself a favor by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sruffs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while we visited Indianapolis Speedway. We booked through hotwire and got a really good price which suprised me as other hotels in the area had put their prices up during Moto GP weekend. When we got to the hotel the receptionist was very friendly and gave us a tour of all the hotel amenities. The room was clean and spacious and the bed was one of the most comfortable and biggest I have ever slept in. The location was good, it wasn't too far to drive to the Speedway and it was right beside a decent mall. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay at Keystone at the Crossing”
Reviews.Author: deeindiana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a couple years ago when it was the Americansuites. They have refurbished it with a stylish, sort of 70's feel that was very "cool". There is a 24-hour snack bar at the front desk that featured pre-made deli-type sandwiches, fruit, salads, baked goods, coffees and drinks. The staff was very welcoming. Our room was on the fifth floor. The elevator and room hallways seemed tired and a little musty (compared to the trendy lobby) and we were worried about our room. But there was no need to fret. The 70's style was continued in the room with relaxing gold/tan/brown decor. There was a huge sectional couch, frig and desk in the first room. Smallish double beds, dresser, large mirrors, well-lighted sink were in the second room. Between the two was an enormous 42" plasma TV that had my husband giddy with pleasure. I was thrilled to have FREE wireless in the room! You don't get that very often! The bathroom is very small and looks pretty old (the old-fashion ceiling heat lamps had been replaced with swirled, fluorescent bulbs). But *shrug* we didn't care. The shower and toilet were fine. One complaint was the air conditioning. The unit was incredibly loud. When it kicked in, we could barely hear the TV and it woke us up several times during the night. No idea if it was just our unit or if other rooms have a similar problem. The only other complaint was the double beds. They were HARD. Lots of nice fluffy pillows, but our beds were like boards. My husband likes a form mattress, but I had a backache in the morning. The location is in the same parking area as the very upscale Keystone at the Crossing Fashion Mall *Saks Fifth Ave., Nordstrums, Crate & Barrel). There are plenty of restaurants nearby. We got a good deal of $107.00 online at their website. Once Indianapolis added on their tourism tax, it was $124.00. Other than the bed and noisy air conditioning, we enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: MeganFlorida
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel. The rooms were large, and the set up with the sitting area and huge t.v. were great. The room and bathroom were very clean. The staff was very nice and helpful. However, the sheets were so rough and scratchy that my kids slept in their jeans. Also, the soap and shampoo that they provided smelled horrible - this is an odd problem I have never encountered in any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to love”
Reviews.Author: LuvToTravel56
Reviews.Content: I was moving to Indianapolis and needed a place to stay during the week for 3 weeks. I tried Priceline for the first time and was pleasantly shocked the deal I got each week. The rooms were very clean, the staff was very friendly, the location is exceptional, free wireless is great and the 42" plasma was icing on top of the cake. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: tiffanylynzer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a weekend in Indianapolis and had a great stay. I loved the contemporary design of the hotel and the huge, comfortable beds! Having a plasma screen to watch TV on was awesome too :) This hotel is right next to the Keystone Mall and plenty of restaurants. I used the gym in the mornings and was suprised to find such a clean facility and nice equipment (with built-in TVs). The continental breakfast was respectable. You can order "better" food for an additional fee (like waffles and eggs). We plan on going back to this hotel again and again!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Place Indianapolis/Keystone
HotelInfo.Address: 9104 Keystone Crossing, Indianapolis, IN 46240 (Formerly "AmeriSuites")
